attributes.action: Accept EU Covid Certificates held by UK citizens resident in EU for entry to UK.
attributes.additional_details: The situation in which the UK Government is not accepting the EU Covid Certificate for entry to the UK by travellers from the EU (unless they are registered with a GP in the UK) presents an unwarranted barrier to UK citizens resident in the EU, most of whom are not registered with a UK GP, but who are free to travel to any other EU country on presentation of the EU Certificate. We ask that this barrier be removed.
attributes.background: We ask the Government to observe international practice in relation to the provisions for international travel of  individuals who carry a valid vaccination certificate providing protection against COVID-19, subject to the restrictions applying to destinations in the Green, Amber and Red categories.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced that it is waiving quarantine for arrivals fully vaccinated from Europe from 4am on 2 August 2021. You can find out more about this here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/uk-travel-update-government-waives-quarantine-for-arrivals-fully-vaccinated-from-europe-and-usa-while-also-confirming-international-cruise-restart

We have published the following related petition, which you might like to sign:

Seek to agree upon equivalence of NHS Covid pass and European Covid Green Pass: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593188
